verses.verse: A Prayer <WH8605> of Moses <WH4872> the man <WH376> of God. <WH430> Lord, <WH136> thou <WH859> hast been <WH1961> our dwelling place <WH4583> in all generations. <WH1755> <WH1755>

Before <WH2962> the mountains <WH2022> were brought forth, <WH3205> or ever thou hadst formed <WH2342> the earth <WH776> and the world, <WH8398> even from everlasting <WH4480> <WH5769> to <WH5704> everlasting, <WH5769> thou <WH859> art God. <WH410>
Thou turnest <WH7725> man <WH582> to <WH5704> destruction; <WH1793> and sayest, <WH559> Return, <WH7725> ye children <WH1121> of men. <WH120>
For <WH3588> a thousand <WH505> years <WH8141> in thy sight <WH5869> are but as yesterday <WH3117> <WH865> when <WH3588> it is past, <WH5674> and as a watch <WH821> in the night. <WH3915>
Thou carriest them away as with a flood; <WH2229> they are <WH1961> as a sleep: <WH8142> in the morning <WH1242> they are like grass <WH2682> which groweth up. <WH2498>
In the morning <WH1242> it flourisheth, <WH6692> and groweth up; <WH2498> in the evening <WH6153> it is cut down, <WH4135> and withereth. <WH3001>
For <WH3588> we are consumed <WH3615> by thine anger, <WH639> and by thy wrath <WH2534> are we troubled. <WH926>
Thou hast set <WH7896> our iniquities <WH5771> before <WH5048> thee, our secret <WH5956> sins in the light <WH3974> of thy countenance. <WH6440>
For <WH3588> all <WH3605> our days <WH3117> are passed away <WH6437> in thy wrath: <WH5678> we spend <WH3615> our years <WH8141> as <WH3644> a tale <WH1899> that is told.

The days <WH3117> of our years <WH8141> are threescore years and ten; <WH7657> <WH8141> and if <WH518> by reason of strength <WH1369> they be fourscore <WH8084> years, <WH8141> yet is their strength <WH7296> labor <WH5999> and sorrow; <WH205> for <WH3588> it is soon <WH2440> cut off, <WH1468> and we fly away. <WH5774>
Who <WH4310> knoweth <WH3045> the power <WH5797> of thine anger? <WH639> even according to thy fear, <WH3374> so is thy wrath. <WH5678>
So <WH3651> teach <WH3045> us to number <WH4487> our days, <WH3117> that we may apply <WH935> our hearts <WH3824> unto wisdom. <WH2451>
Return, <WH7725> O LORD, <WH3068> how long? <WH5704> <WH4970> and let it repent <WH5162> thee concerning <WH5921> thy servants. <WH5650>
O satisfy <WH7646> us early <WH1242> with thy mercy; <WH2617> that we may rejoice <WH7442> and be glad <WH8055> all <WH3605> our days. <WH3117>
Make us glad <WH8055> according to the days <WH3117> wherein thou hast afflicted <WH6031> us, and the years <WH8141> wherein we have seen <WH7200> evil. <WH7451>
Let thy work <WH6467> appear <WH7200> unto <WH413> thy servants, <WH5650> and thy glory <WH1926> unto <WH5921> their children. <WH1121>

And let the beauty <WH5278> of the LORD <WH136> our God <WH430> be <WH1961> upon <WH5921> us: and establish <WH3559> thou the work <WH4639> of our hands <WH3027> upon <WH5921> us; yea, the work <WH4639> of our hands <WH3027> establish <WH3559> thou it.
